page.title: 10Farming. Employment.
page.content: We went to Newcourt Farm to talk to Mr. Mercer.The farmhouse is over 300 years old and is possibly marked on a map dated 1590. He manages a mixed farm covering 2116 acres. 15 people work on the farm including Mr. Mercer.He gets up at 6.30 every morning to tell the men what to do. Then he visits the 3 dairies, has breakfast, goes to check the crops and then onto his office at Langford Castle to do the paperwork. He checks the cattle during the day. He has been living in Downton for 18 years. He said he liked the satisfaction of being responsible for all that he could see. On the farm he grows wheat, barley and grass. On the east side of the main road, the A 338, the ground is river gravel. On the west side it is chalk. He keeps sheep and cows. He has 364 cows and likes them the best.
